comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:10.0a1) Gecko/20111017 Firefox/10.0a1
Build ID: 20111017031010

Steps to reproduce:

For some reason, Nightly maxes out my CPU and hangs, pretending to be or snail-loading a tab. Sometimes it finishes loading after a long while, sometimes it does not, so I kill it through the task manager. When restarted, only the main window is opened as it was, the second window I had opened was gone.


Actual results:

I have no idea why the Nightly hangs in the first place. I have an Athlon 64 3200+ on 2 GHz, 3 GB of RAM and am running Win7 on 64-bit (browser is the 64 bit version). Generally, after restart, it loads the previously hung page with ease. I should mention that I have "do not load Tabs until selected" selected. 


Expected results:

It should have opened the second tab as well, just like it used to. It did not happen before today, today I experienced it twice already, I mean the losing of the secondary window. I don't know if the same thing happens if you have more windows opened. The hogging of CPU and loading problems I have since you introduced the plugin container, which I did not encounter in this version of the Firefox. Additionally, I had trouble installing Flash in general. I am currently running some beta x64 version I found God knows where on Adobe. Flash update does not work as of yet, If a change happens, I'll report here.
